abstract.text: A top-to-bottom linear value ramp (gradient) generator.

inlineContent.text: The top value of the interpolation.
The bottom value of the interpolation.
The 2D coordinate at which the data is read in order to map the texture onto a surface. The default is to use the current

This node uses interpolation to create a vertical ramp or gradient from two values. Any point within the output ramp is a mix of the two values. A given point is more similar to the value that its vertical position is closer to.
Below is a an example of a simple node graph that uses Ramp Vertical to create a color gradient.
The image below shows the resulting texture, along with the color values on either side.

abstract.text: Create custom materials and effects for 3D content in Reality Composer Pro.
Generate 2D gradients, noise, and other patterns programmatically for your material.
A four-point linear value ramp (gradient) generator.
A left-to-right linear value ramp (gradient) generator.
A top-to-bottom linear value ramp (gradient) generator.
A left-to-right split matte, split at a specified U value.
A top-to-bottom split matte, split at a specified V value.
